Loaders¶

This module contains the various functions used to load and manipulate data and information agnostic to the model class used. These functions are used in all classes, and can be called if creating your own model class.

xpot.loaders.autoplex_return(run_path: str, single: bool = False, single_loss: float = 1) → tuple[float, float, float]¶

Return the autoplex-compatible loss, train error, and test error of the best potential from an optimization sweep.

Parameters:

  • run_path (str) – The path to the run directory.

  • single (bool, optional) – Whether the run is a single fit, by default False.

  • single_loss (float, optional) – The loss value for a single fit, this should be set manually, but is by default 1.

Returns:

The loss, train error, and test error of the potential with the lowest loss.

Return type:

tuple

xpot.loaders.convert_numpy_types(data)¶

Convert numpy string to native string type. Used to avoid errors when writing yaml files.

Parameters:

data (any) – The variable to be converted.

Returns:

The variable with numpy strings converted to native strings.

Return type:

any

xpot.loaders.directory_setup(path: str) → None¶

Set up the directory for the potential fitting.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to the directory.

xpot.loaders.get_defaults(path: str) → dict[str, NestedDict | Any]¶

Get the default parameters from a json file.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to the json file.

Returns:

The default parameters in dictionary format.

Return type:

dict

xpot.loaders.get_input_hypers(path: str) → dict[str, NestedDict | Any]¶

Get the input hyperparameters from a hjson file.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to the json file.

Returns:

The input hyperparameters in dictionary format.

Return type:

dict

xpot.loaders.get_optimisable_params(hypers: dict[str, NestedDict | Any]) → dict[tuple[str, ...], Dimension]¶

Extract the optimisable parameters from the hyperparameters.

Parameters:

hypers (dict) – The hyperparameters in dictionary format.

Returns:

The optimisable parameters in dictionary format.

Return type:

dict

xpot.loaders.list_to_string(d: dict[str, NestedDict | Any]) → dict[str, NestedDict | Any]¶

Convert lists to strings in a dictionary. Specifically used for SNAP [GROUPS] section.

Parameters:

d (dict) – The nested dictionary to be converted.

Returns:

The dictionary with lists converted to strings.

Return type:

dict

xpot.loaders.merge_hypers(defaults: dict[str, NestedDict | Any], inputs: dict[str, NestedDict | Any]) → dict[str, NestedDict | Any]¶

Merge the default parameters and input hyperparameters.

Parameters:

  • defaults (dict) – The default parameters in dictionary format.

  • inputs (dict) – The input hyperparameters in dictionary format.

Returns:

The merged parameters in dictionary format, with input hyperparameters overriding the defaults initially loaded.

Return type:

dict

xpot.loaders.prep_dict_for_dump(d: dict) → dict¶

Prepare a dictionary for dumping to a file by removing numpy int and float types.

Parameters:

d (dict) – The nested dictionary to be dumped.

Returns:

The dictionary with numpy types converted to native types.

Return type:

dict

xpot.loaders.reconstitute_lists(hypers: dict[str, NestedDict | Any], opt_values: dict) → dict[str, NestedDict | Any]¶

Reconstitute lists from separated keys sorted by index in the hyperparameter dictionary.

Parameters:

  • hypers (dict) – The hyperparameters in dictionary format, with lists separated into key per index.

  • opt_values (dict) – The optimiser values in dictionary format, with tuple keys representing the nested keys of the hyperparameters in the dictionary.

Returns:

The hyperparameters dictionary with lists reconstituted into single key: value pairs.

Return type:

dict

xpot.loaders.recursive_items(d: dict[str, dict | str], previous_keys: list[str] | None = None) → Iterator[tuple[tuple[str, ...], str]]¶

Iterate over a dictionary recursively, yielding a tuple of nested keys and a value.

xpot.loaders.return_best_potential(run_path: str) → str¶

Return the path to the potential with the lowest loss from an optimization sweep.

Parameters:

run_path (str) – The path to the run directory.

Returns:

The path to the best potential.

Return type:

str

xpot.loaders.single_autoplex_return(run_path: str, loss: float) → tuple[float, float, float]¶

Return the autoplex-compatible loss, train error, and test error of a single potential from a single fit. :param run_path: The path to the run directory. :type run_path: str

Returns:

The loss, train error, and test error of the potential with the lowest loss.

Return type:

tuple

xpot.loaders.trim_empty_values(dict_in: dict[str, NestedDict | Any]) → dict[str, str | int | float | list]¶

Remove empty values from a dictionary.

Parameters:

dict_in (dict) – The input dictionary.

Returns:

The dictionary with empty values removed.

Return type:

dict

xpot.loaders.validate_hypers(merged_hypers: dict[str, NestedDict | Any], input_hypers: dict[str, NestedDict | Any]) → bool¶

Validate the hyperparameters.

Parameters:

  • merged_hypers (dict) – The merged dictionary of defaults and hypers.

  • input_hypers (dict) – A dictionary of a subset of values (normally input hypers).

Raises:

ValueError – If the input hyperparameters are not a subset of the merged parameters.

xpot.loaders.validate_subdict(parent: dict[str, NestedDict | Any], child: dict[str, NestedDict | Any]) → bool¶

Validate that the child dictionary is a subset of the parent dictionary. Used to validate that the input hyperparameters have been correctly loaded over the default parameters.

Parameters:

  • parent (dict) – The parent dictionary.

  • child (dict) – The child dictionary.

Returns:

True if the child dictionary is a subset of the parent dictionary.

Return type:

bool

xpot.loaders.write_error_file(iteration: int, errors: list[float], filename: str)¶

Write the error values to a file.

Parameters:

  • e_train (float) – The energy training error.

  • f_train (float) – The force training error.

  • e_test (float) – The energy validation error.

  • f_test (float) – The force validation error.

  • filename (str) – The file to write to.
